description: [The Herald] Global demand for critical minerals is projected to grow three-fold by 2040, presenting a strategic opportunity for African producers including Zimbabwe to increase output and the development of untapped mineral deposits.
title: Africa: Growing Demand for Key Minerals Boon for Africa

description: [Egypt Online] Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouli on Monday inaugurated, on behalf of President Abdel Fattah El Sisi, the third edition of Africa Health ExCon, the largest African health exhibition and conference, under the theme "Your Gateway to Innovation and Trade."
title: Africa: PM Witnesses Inauguration of African Health Exco 2024 Conf. and Exhibition

description: [COP28 UAR] The COP28 Presidency has announced the launch of the Technical Cooperation Collaborative (TCC) to support the implementation of the COP28 UAE Declaration on Sustainable Agriculture, Resilient Food Systems, and Climate Action.
title: Africa: Technical Group Takes Up COP28 Food Systems, Climate Action Pledge

description: [New Times] China-Africa trade cooperation is playing a pivotal role in fostering inclusive and sustainable development across Africa, according to a senior official with the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD), Xinhua reports.
title: Africa: China-Africa Trade Cooperation Fosters Inclusive, Sustainable Growth in Africa - UNCTAD Official

description: [ISS] The punitive measures reflect a history of major EU investment in Ethiopia's migration governance - with few results.
title: Africa: EU Visa Restrictions On Ethiopians Reflect Strained Migration Relations

description: [Accra Times] Thrilling the audiences in London, the duo put on a compelling dance performance beginning their routine with African-themed songs, including Lebohang Morake's "Circle of Life," and gracefully ending their energetic performance with Fuse ODG's "Antenna remix" featuring Wyclef Jean.
title: Africa: Britain's Got Talent - Afronitaa and Abigail Dromo Finish Third Place With Thrilling Performance

description: [African Arguments] Land grabbing is not just back with a vengeance. It is taking on new guises such as carbon offsets, green hydrogen schemes, and other "green grabs".
title: Africa: Land Squeeze - the Hidden Battle for Africa's Soils

description: [WHO] Honourable Minister Dr Edwin Dikoloti, President of the Seventy-seventh World Health Assembly,
title: Africa: WHO Director-General's Closing Remarks At the Seventy-Seventh World Health Assembly - 1 June 2024

description: [Africa CDC] A programme to train leaders in the health system to address mental health in Africa through a public health and human rights lens was launched during the 77th World Health Assembly in Geneva.
title: Africa: Africa CDC Launches Mental Health Leadership Programme

description: [Africa CDC] African health ministers have offered to ensure commitment and support to buy vaccines manufactured in Africa to build a sustainable industry capable of producing vaccines at scale.
title: Africa: African Health Ministers Commit to Purchasing Locally-Made Vaccines

description: [Africa CDC] The Lancet Series on AMR, recently launched on the margins of the World Health Assembly, highlights that babies, older people and people with compromised immune systems are at the most significant risk of suffering from antimicrobial resistance.
title: Africa: New Study Calls for Access to Effective Antibiotics in Africa

description: [New Dawn] The African Development Bank Group says it is in very strong financial shape and ready to contribute to major development projects on the Continent.
title: Africa: AfDB Announces Over $ 3.5bn Mobilization for Liberty Corridor

description: [The Conversation Africa] Africa's share of global trade remains disproportionately small, hovering around 2%-3%. Countries on the continent trade more with the rest of the world than they do among themselves. Africa needs to improve its share of trade to boost growth and reduce poverty.
title: Africa: African Countries Could Unlock Billions in Local and Global Trade - What's Working and What's Not
